In this blog post, I am gonna talk about the difference between:

![Rails](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e9/Ruby_on_Rails.svg/150px-Ruby_on_Rails.svg.png) 

**and**

![Django](https://mikehking.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/python-django.jpg)


-----------

Django vs Python
==========

First, I'll talk about rails:

 1. It is made using ruby. The front end is VanillaJS+Jquery and back end is ruby
 2. It follows convention over configuration. This means it identifies files based on their name.
 3. It uses bundler for managing project dependencies.

Secondly, in django:

 1. It is made in python. It is the same as rails but the back end is python not ruby
 2. It insists on using a virtualenv to isolate python development
 
-----------

Job Based Analysis
==========
 In New York, there are currently four times more Rails jobs available than Django. However, there are more than twice as many Python jobs than there are Ruby. If you are looking to develop a career solely in Web development than Ruby on Rails might be the best choice. However, if you are looking to build a base in a language that has professional applications across the board than Django and Python might be your best choice.

---------

Final Conclusion
====

Learning either framework is a great way to mature your understanding of Web development once you locked down the basics of HTML and CSS. While the end game is the same, getting started is fairly different. If you are a control freak who prefers tinkering under the hood and getting the hard part out of the way first, then Django is a great choice. 

![django](data:image/png;base64,)

If you prefer to quickly launch your first Web application, gain some insight into how frameworks are implemented, and worry about the details later,  Rails will get you on that fast track.

![rails](data:image/png;base64,)
